video.title: TEDTalks: Music Revolution
video.synopsis: The world's most mesmerizing artists push the boundaries of music with jaw-dropping performances and breathtaking ideas.

episodes.synopsis: Composer Eric Whitacre led a virtual choir of singers from around the world, powered by YouTube.
episodes.title: Eric Whitacre: A Virtual Choir 2,000 Voices Strong

episodes.synopsis: Benjamin Zander has two infectious passions: classical music, and helping us all realize our untapped love for it.
episodes.title: Benjamin Zander on Music and Passion

episodes.synopsis: Charismatic founder of a youth orchestra system has transformed thousands of kids' lives in Venezuela.
episodes.title: Jose Abreu on Kids Transformed by Music

episodes.synopsis: Onyx Ashanti demonstrates "beatjazz" with an iPhone and a mouthpiece, and played with the entire body.
episodes.title: Onyx Ashanti: This Is Beatjazz

episodes.synopsis: One-of-a-kind R&B group Naturally 7 beatboxes an orchestra's worth of instruments to groove through their smooth single.
episodes.title: Naturally 7 Beatboxes a Whole Band

episodes.synopsis: Musician David Byrne asks: Does the venue make the music? How has context pushed musical innovation?
episodes.title: David Byrne: How Architecture Helped Music Evolve

episodes.synopsis: Jazz pianist Eric Lewis sets fire to the keys with his shattering rendition of Evanescence's chart-topper, "Going Under."
episodes.title: Eric Lewis Rocks the Jazz World

episodes.synopsis: The first female on Rolling Stone's "guitar god" list rocks out to a full live set at TED2008 with jaw-dropping virtuosity.
episodes.title: Kaki King Rocks Out to Pink Noise

episodes.synopsis: A deaf percussionist illustrates how listening to music involves much more than simply letting sound waves hit your eardrums.
episodes.title: Evelyn Glennie Shows How to Listen

episodes.synopsis: Musical innovator Andrew Bird becomes a riveting one-man orchestra.
episodes.title: Andrew Bird's One-Man Orchestra of the Imagination

episodes.synopsis: Pianist and composer Jennifer Lin improvises a moving solo piece based on a random sequence of notes.
episodes.title: Jennifer Lin Improvs Piano Magic

episodes.synopsis: The 11-year-old violinist Sirena Huang gives a technically brilliant and emotionally nuanced performance.
episodes.title: Sirena Huang Dazzles on Violin

episodes.synopsis: The violinist talks about a violin lesson he once gave to a brilliant, schizophrenic musician -- and what he learned.
episodes.title: Robert Gupta: Music Is Medicine, Music Is Sanity

episodes.synopsis: Organ virtuoso Qi Zhang plays "Ridiculous Fellows" from Prokofiev's "The Love for Three Oranges" orchestral suite.
episodes.title: Qi Zhang's Electrifying Organ Performance

episodes.synopsis: Percussionist Sivamani uses traditional Western and Eastern instruments to create a rhythmic tour de force.
episodes.title: Sivamani: Rhythm Is Everything, Everywhere

episodes.synopsis: Human beatbox James "AudioPoet" Burchfield performs an intricate three-minute breakdown all using only his voice.
episodes.title: James Burchfield Plays (Invisible) Turntables

episodes.synopsis: Michael Tilson Thomas traces the evolution of classical music through the development of written notation, the record and the remix.
episodes.title: Michael Tilson Thomas: Music and Emotion Through Time

episodes.synopsis: Beatboxer Beardyman has built a machine that creates loops and layers from just the sounds he makes with his voice, mimicking almost any instrument.
episodes.title: Beardyman: The Polyphonic Me

episodes.synopsis: Abigail Washburn speaks of the remarkable connections she's formed while touring the U.S. and China while playing the banjo and singing in Chinese.
episodes.title: Abigail Washburn: Building US-China Relations… By Banjo

episodes.synopsis: Usman Riaz, a young whiz at the percussive guitar, and master of percussive guitar Preston Reed take on a very spur-of-the-moment improv session.
episodes.title: Usman Riaz & Preston Reed: A Young Guitarist Meets His Hero

episodes.synopsis: Violinist Robert Gupta tells a story of society's marginalized and the power of music therapy, which can succeed where conventional medicine fails.
episodes.title: Robert Gupta: Between Music and Medicine

episodes.synopsis: Ryan Holladay experiments with "location-aware music" -- geotagged segments of sounds that only play when a listener is physically nearby.
episodes.title: Ryan Holladay: To Hear This Music You Have to Be There. Literally

episodes.synopsis: Adam Ockelford explains Derek Paravicini's unique relationship to music, while Paravicini shows how he has ripped up the "Chopsticks" rule book.
episodes.title: Derek Paravicini and Adam Ockelford: In the Key of Genius

episodes.synopsis: Beatboxer Tom Thum slings beats, comedy and a mouthful of instrumental impersonations into 11 minutes of creativity and fun.
episodes.title: Tom Thum: The Orchestra in My Mouth
